title: Estimating and determining particle motion part - b

content.description: The velocity of a particle moving along the x-axis is modeled by a differentiable function v, where the position x is measured in meters, and time t is measured in seconds. Selected values of v(t) are given in the table above. The particle is at position x=7 meters when t=0 seconds.
content.question: Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44BB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of this problem. Use a trapezoidal sum with the three subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44BB@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: Using correct units, explain the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44BB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of this problem. Use a trapezoidal sum with the three subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>v</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44BB@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
